content.heroIntro:

faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. EU citizens enjoy equal rights as Spanish nationals. Non-EU citizens must obtain a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), but purchase restrictions do not apply based on nationality. CORMINSA and local legal professionals can guide you through the straightforward acquisition process.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Spanish property purchase costs typically include: transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), notary fees (0.5-1%), registration fees (0.1%), and legal representation costs (0.5-1%). For Alicante region, total acquisition costs average 8-10% above purchase price. Our team provides detailed cost breakdowns during the inquiry process.
